greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T[i+1,j] = prime(T[i,j]), T[1,j] = j-th nonprime = A018252(j); read by upward antidiagonals.
comment: For i>1, T[i,j] = A018252(j)-th number among those not occurring in rows < i.
Transpose of A114537. See that sequence and the link for more information and references.
reference: Alexandrov, Lubomir. "On the nonasymptotic prime number distribution." arXiv preprint math/9811096 (1998). (See Appendix.)
link: N. Fernandez, An order of primeness, F(p).
N. Fernandez, An order of primeness [cached copy, included with permission of the author]
formula: T[i,j] = j-th number for which A078442 equals i-1.
example: The first row (1,4,6,8,9,10...) of the array gives the nonprime numbers A018252.
The 2nd row (2,7,13,19,23,29,37,...) of the array gives the primes with nonprime index, A000040(A018252(j)) = A007821(j).
Column j is the sequence b(n+1)=prime(b(n)) starting with b(j)=A018252(j): A007097, A057450, A057451, A057452, A057453, A057456, A057457, ...
mathematica: t[1, 1] = 1; t[1, 2] = 4; t[1, k_] := (p = t[1, k-1]; If[ PrimeQ[p+1], p+2, p+1]); t[n_ /; n > 1, k_] := Prime[t[n-1, k]]; Flatten[ Table[ t[n, k-n+1], {k, 1, 9}, {n, 1, k}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 03 2011 *)
program: (PARI) p=c=0; T=matrix( 10,10, i,j, if( i==1, while( isprime(c++),); p=c, p=prime(p))); A138947=concat( vector( vecmin( matsize( T )),i, vector( i,j, T[ j,i+1-j ])))
xref: If the antidiagonals are read in the opposite direction we get A114537.
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 28 2008
